text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with garlic and blue cheese green
bean almandine that's right I never get
excited over green bean side dishes but
today is no exception however we have
taken one of the most cliched side
dishes in history
the venerable green bean Almondine and
we tricked it out a little bit with some
roasted garlic and blue cheese and it
was really good
so step one we're gonna roast some
garlic which is so easy we're gonna take
a whole head of garlic and we're gonna
cut the top 1/3 off with a sharp knife
just like that that's gonna expose all
those cloves there you go
full clove exposure by the way do not
throw away the top we're gonna roast all
of it so I did that to three whole heads
of garlic
once the garlic's caught we're gonna
take a heat proof dish any kind of
baking dish will work I'm gonna line it
with some heavy-duty aluminum foil I'm
gonna place it on our heads of garlic
alright cut side up I'm gonna toss in
the tops now you'll notice some of the
clothes came loose from that top piece
that's okay just toss them in I'm gonna
douse that with a little bit of olive
oil and a nice big pinch of salt and
then we're simply gonna fold it up and I
saw chef do this on TV a few weeks ago
and they made it look so complicated
like they were trying to build some kind
of hang glider to escape from a
mountaintop prison which by the way
would be a cool movie but anyway this is
not complex just folded up like that
this does not have to be airtight you're
just trying to shield it from direct
heat so once that's wrapped we're gonna
pop it in a 375-degree oven for about an
hour or until this happens those cloves
rose to a gorgeous golden brown and you
can see here the knife will go right in
those are just completely completely
soft all right and once those are cold
enough to handle we're gonna remove all
the garlic by the way do not toss that
amazing olive oil at the bottom are you
gonna add that in also now you can pop
these close out with a knife sort of one
at a time
like I said they should be completely
completely soft or if you want you can
grab the bottom of the clove the pointy
end and squeeze and everything will
squeeze out that cut end so you can do
it either way but bottom line remove
everything you can including every last
drop of that oil very flavorful do not
waste it okay so our roasted garlic is
done we're gonna just reserve that until
needed next up we're gonna prep our
green beans so I have here about
pound or so of your standard green beans
I believe these are Blue Lake but any
standard green bean from the supermarket
will work
of course we've trimmed the ends and
what we're gonna do here we're gonna
blanch these in some salted water for a
few minutes to give a head start so I
want you to add a good amount of salt to
water bring it up to a full boil on high
heat dump in the beans it's gonna take
about two minutes or so to come back to
a simmer and once it does I want you to
simmer it for three or four minutes or
until the beans are just starting to get
tender I'm gonna say just to give you a
guide like 75% of the way cooked okay as
soon as that happens quickly remove them
from the boiling water and plunge them
into ice water or very very cold water
you actually don't need ice but should
be very cold that's gonna stop the
cooking process and then once those are
completely cold go ahead and drain them
really well and throw them in a bowl all
right so while our beans are chilling
we're gonna go ahead with the last of
the prep here I'm gonna take some sliced
almonds and a little bit of butter on
medium heat and I guess you could use
slivered almonds but I like to slice I
really like the contrast with the dark
skin but you use what you want you are
the boss of your nuts and I'm just gonna
toast those for about three or four
minutes until they just start to turn
golden brown all right something like
that all right once those are done
you're gonna set those aside and we're
on to final assembly and you know how
much I love final assembly so here we go
so I've tossed my now completely cold
and fully drained beans into a bowl
we're gonna add all the roasted garlic
and any residual oil from the foil
packet I'm gonna add an additional
tablespoon or so of olive oil I'm also
gonna dump in some salts so freshly
ground black pepper and maybe a little
cayenne I'm not sure all right let's do
it little Cayenne we're gonna dump in
our toasted almonds and we're gonna give
that a nice toss all right and what will
happen that roasted garlic is soft and
kind of sticky and that along with the
olive oil is gonna coat those beans and
those almond pieces are gonna stick to
the beans and it's gonna be a beautiful
thing so keep tossing until it looks
like that at that point we're gonna
transfer that into a baking dish I'm
gonna distribute those as evenly as
possible if there's any sliced almonds
or remnants of garlic in the bowl of
course toss that in
and then last but certainly not even
close to least we need some of this a
high quality blue cheese I'm using a
variety called point raised which is
just spectacular
just a full-flavored beautifully pungent
blue cheese and you don't need too much
I'm just gonna crumble over here maybe
two ounces alright a little bit goes a
long way all right once the cheese has
crumbled over I don't know why but I
saved like a tablespoon of sliced
almonds to top this with which was kind
of dumb cuz you can't even tell but you
know what I had to explain the shot and
that is officially ready for the oven by
the way do not give it the old tap a
tappa
all right we don't just tap things
because we feel like it there has to be
a reason to tap that do not abuse your
old tap a tap of privileges so that's
sat we're gonna pop it in a hot oven 400
degrees for about 15 minutes or until
the beans are tender and the cheese is
melty and it's gonna look something
remarkably similar to this and that is
done a fairly exciting version of green
bean almandine if that's even possible
and what makes this so good check it out
perfectly cooked beans buttery toasted
crunchy almonds that sweet roasted
garlic
nothing like roasted garlic kind of the
glue that holds all this together and
then of course everything gets elevated
by that creamy yet very very sharp tangy
intense blue cheese just a beautiful
combination of tastes and textures so if
you're looking for a special occasion
side dish this will be perfect but you
know what forget about special occasions
this is also just a great easy weeknight
side dish to go with a plain old roast
chicken all right so I really hope you
give this a try head over to food
whooshes calm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
